title: Yahoo Mail won't load
content:
Wednesday evening, I started having problems loading yahoo mail on firefox. I ignored it, thinking it would resolve itself. The next day at work, I had the same problem. I tried Microsoft edge, and it worked fine. Today, I downloaded the latest Firefox update, but I still can't get my yahoo mail to load. I've contacted yahoo, and thus far got no help. Both computers are running Windows 10. I get the following error message: An error occurred while processing your request.

Reference #97.d0ee3e17.1616768232.261b7f88

Thanks for any assistance JoAnne
creator: joannelj

title: Videos no youtube travando.
content: Videos no youtube travam em resolução 1080p 30fps e 60fps, mas videos com resolução 720p 30fps ou 60fps não travam, eu uso linux mint mate, mas no windows 10 nao tive esses problemas.

creator: Mathias_Will

title: FF 87 new 'Highlight All' scrollbar visual update causing searching to be extremely laggy/slow
content:
I regularly use the 'Highlight All' feature when using 'Find in page' but since the Firefox 87 update, this is now almost useless to me.

If I press Ctrl+F and search for something in a large text list (55000 lines) it will be quick and show the next result instantly when I click the down arrow but as soon as I click 'Highlight All' there is a noticeable 2-3 second lag while it populates the scroll bar with the visual cues of where the search results are in the page, then if I click the down arrow to search for the next reason the page freezes and it takes multiple seconds to jump to the next result.

Before the FF87 update Highlight All worked absolutely fine and was as quick as jumping to the next result as not using Highlight All.

Since FF87, Highlight All makes the experience of searching a file so slow that I waste too much time waiting and so I've just stopped using it.


Is there an about:config method of disabling the new 'scrollbar visuals'?

I'm using a device with a slow CPU (N4100) but as I mentioned, there was no problem with this function before the latest update. I don't really care where in the document the result is, so I'd prefer to just turn off this new feature.
creator: fusen

title: Pop-up windows exceptions not working in private mode (Firefox 87.0)
content:
Hi,

After an update on Firefox 87.0 the pop-up exceptions defined are not working in private mode. A yellow bar appears that tells me that prevent the popups. If I choose to allow the popups with the button on the left of url then the url is added on exceptions/allowed window with a ^privateBrowsingId=1 marked in the url. However this is not persisted on a next run of firefox on private mode.

If someone have setup exceptions is there for a reason and should not be broken in private mode. I also cannot add ^privateBrowsingId=1 on my own in the url on the exceptions, as it appeared as %5 in exceptions and it does not work to allow pop-up.

Thanks
creator: JenniferRhodes1

title: Firefox 87 Completing a form maximizes and minimizes the form with every character input
content:
Since updating to Firefox 87, when I enter characters in a form, it gets minimized and maximized with every character input - this is not a public website so I can't provide more details

Using firefox Inspector :

[ height is set to :auto ] <textarea name="template-name" dojoattachpoint="focusNode,containerNode" id="template-name" class="tempFldClass dijitTextArea" style="width: 99%; overflow: auto hidden; box-sizing: border-box; height: auto;" title="Comments" tabindex="0" widgetid="template-name" rows="3" spellcheck="false"></textarea>

[ Clicking or entering any character, the following values are updated :height: 57px; max-height: 2px ]

<textarea name="template-name" dojoattachpoint="focusNode,containerNode" id="template-name" class="tempFldClass dijitTextArea" style="width: 99%; overflow: auto hidden; box-sizing: border-box; height: 57px; max-height: 2px;" title="Comments" tabindex="0" widgetid="template-name" rows="3" spellcheck="false"></textarea>

title: Stop Firefox URL suggestions pop-up below the bookmark bar.
content:
Hi Team,

Really need help. Every time I try to search for a word, a single word in the address bar, the moment I hit <enter>, I not only get the desired search engine results but also do get an annoying URL-suggestion pop-up strip in the browser, just below the bookmark bar which basically suggestions a URL for that word.

ex. If I search for a single word like: "Nasdaq", I get a pop-up strip below the book-mark bar asking me if I was searching for "www.nasdaq.com"?

  • screenshot attached here.

This has become real annoying now as I use the browser on my office machine. Your kind suggestions on how to get rid of this browser behavior will be extremely helpful.
creator: pravin.n15

title: Cannot open Firefox with version 87.0
content:
After installing Firefox Version 87.0 today, I haven't been able to open the application. Each time I try I get the following error message, "Windows cannot access the specified device, path, or file. You may not have the appropriate permissions to access the item." I have tried both running the installer again to fix it and downloading a new copy of the installer and running it, neither of which solved the issue.

I found a previous thread from 2018 detailing the same issue (wherein the chosen solution was to make sure that your firewall wasn't blocking firefox's access to the internet) however;

A) I can't even start the firefox application, let alone see if it can access the internet. B) I tried making my antivirus application ignore it (Malwarebytes), but when I tried to do so it said I didn't have permissions to access the file.

To be clear mine is the ONLY account on the computer, and is the admin account as a result. My pc is running on Windows 7 64 bit in case that is relevant (though I didn't see anything in the update notes to suggest that they're ending support for Windows 7 just yet).
creator: kaelhound

title: "allow calibre to use IndexedDB storage in your browser"
content: Hello, How do I permit Calibre to use IndexedDB storage in Firefox? I am running Firefox 87.0 on Windows 10. Both are fully updated as of the time of this writing (26 March 2021). In Calibre 5.13.0, I enable "Sharing over the net," then I "Start server," and then I "Test server." Calibre opens a tab in Firefox but returns the following error message: "Error: Could not initialize database You must allow calibre to use IndexedDB storage in your browser to read books" I cannot figure out how to enable IndexedDB storage for Firefox. Thank you in advance for your help, Eric
